column5: * Merck KGAA and Pfizer receive FDA breakthrough therapy designation for Avelumab in metastatic merkel cell carcinoma

column4: Cloud software maker Salesforce adj profit beats estimates
column5: Salesforce.com Inc raised its full-year revenue forecast for the fourth time after reporting a quarterly adjusted profit above market expectations  driven by higher demand for its web-based sales and marketing software.

column4: UPDATE 2-Cloud software maker Salesforce adj profit beats estimates
column5: * Shares rise as much as 6 pct in extended trading   (Adds analysts' comments  details; updates shares)

column4: Cloud software maker Salesforce revenue jumps 23.7 pct
column5: Nov 18 Salesforce.com Inc reported a 23.7 percent jump in quarterly revenue  driven by higher demand for its web-based sales and marketing software.

column4: Sprint to halve bills for those who switch from rival networks
column5: Customers who switch to Sprint Corp from Verizon  AT&T and T-Mobile will have to pay only half of what they pay for their existing plans  the No.4 U.S. carrier said in a bid to lure users to its network ahead of the holiday season.

column4: UPDATE 1-Sprint to halve bills for those who switch from rival networks
column5: Nov 18 Customers who switch to Sprint Corp  from Verizon  AT&T and T-Mobile will have to pay only half of what they pay for their existing plans  the No.4 U.S. carrier said in a bid to lure users to its network ahead of the holiday season.

column4: Sprint offers 50 pct off for users to switch from other carriers
column5: Nov 18 Customers who switch to Sprint from Verizon  AT&T and T-Mobile will have to pay only half of what they pay for their existing plans  the No.4 U.S. carrier said.

column4: Statoil to decide on Snorre 2040 development concept next autumn
column5: STAVANGER  Norway  Nov 18 Norway's Statoil  will decide next autumn on how to upgrade the Snorre oil and gas field in the North Sea  a company executive said on Wednesday.

column4: Suncor cuts 2016 oil sands production due to major maintenance
column5: CALGARY  Alberta Canada's largest oil and gas producer Suncor Energy Inc said on Tuesday 2016 capital spending will increase by around 15 percent from this year but production will drop slightly as a result of major turnarounds on oil sands facilities.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX rises as railways  pipelines gain
column5: TORONTO  Nov 18 Canada's main stock index rose on Wednesday  led by railway and pipeline stocks in a broad-based but relatively shallow recovery from Tuesday's slip.

column4: Fitch Upgrades Synovus Financial to 'BBB-'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  November 18 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has upgraded Synovus Financial  Corp.'s (SNV) and its principal subsidiary Synovus Bank's long-term Issuer  Default Ratings (IDRs) to 'BBB-' from 'BB+' and Viability Ratings (VRs) to  'bbb-' from 'bb+'. At the same time  Fitch has upgraded the companies'  short-term IDRs (IDRs) to 'F3' from 'B'. The Rating Outlook has been revised to  Stable from Positive. A full list of rating actions follows

column4: Target's online sales growth slows; margins pressured
column5: CHICAGO Target Corp  faces margin pressure and will not meet its fiscal-year forecast for online sales growth  which slowed in the latest quarter  the discount retailer said on Wednesday  sending its shares down more than 5 percent.

column4: UPDATE 4-Target's online sales growth slows; margins pressured
column5: CHICAGO  Nov 18 Target Corp faces margin pressure and will not meet its fiscal-year forecast for online sales growth  which slowed in the latest quarter  the discount retailer said on Wednesday  sending its shares down more than 5 percent.

column4: Target raises full-year profit forecast for second time
column5: Nov 18 U.S. retailer Target Corp  reported stronger-than-expected same-store sales for the third quarter and raised its full-year earnings forecast for the second time in three months.

column4: Blackstone's GSO will not backstop SunEdison debt: source
column5: Shares of SunEdison Inc  slid 10 percent in extended trade on Wednesday after Reuters reported that Blackstone Group LP's  credit investment arm GSO was not looking to invest in the solar company  which is facing concerns on Wall Street about its access to capital.

column4: Blackstone's GSO not looking at SunEdison -source
column5: Nov 18 Blackstone Group LP's credit investment arm GSO is not looking to invest in solar company SunEdison Inc  a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday on condition of anonymity.

column4: CORRECTED-Toyota says its fuel-cell vehicle gaining traction in California
column5: LOS ANGELES  Nov 17 Toyota Motor Corp's  hydrogen fuel-cell vehicles are gaining traction in California  where 22 of the company's Mirai cars have been delivered in its first month of availability  company officials said on Tuesday.

column4: In India  where no-frills cars rule  Toyota aims upmarket
column5: BENGALURU  India In a significant and potentially risky move in an Indian market that global automakers use as a test-bed for smaller  no-frills cars  Toyota Motor Corp  is betting on pricier premium models offering better safety and quality.

column4: TransCanada announces new layoffs as crude slump persists
column5: CALGARY  Alberta Pipeline company TransCanada Corp has announced new job cuts  as slumping oil prices continue to take their toll on its customers  a spokesman said on Wednesday.

column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Nov 18 Pipeline company TransCanada Corp has announced new job cuts  as slumping oil prices continue to take their toll on its customers  a spokesman said on Wednesday.

column4: TransCanada withdraws Keystone XL route application in Nebraska
column5: TransCanada Corp is withdrawing its route application for the Keystone XL pipeline in the state of Nebraska after U.S. President Barack Obama denied a permit for the controversial project  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: Ackman's Pershing Square Holdings off 24.5 percent YTD
column5: NEW YORK Billionaire hedge fund manager William Ackman's Pershing Square Holdings portfolio has lost 24.5 percent this year  extending its fall this week as its biggest holding  Valeant Pharmaceuticals  declined further  the company said on its website.

column4: Valeant to offer cash  stock to keep staff after turmoil
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  will likely offer cash and stock incentives to more key U.S. staff as it aims to avoid mass departures from the heavily scrutinized company  a spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

column4: Australia's OzForex says Western Union made takeover approach
column5: SYDNEY  Nov 19 Australian currency exchange provider OzForex Group Ltd said U.S. money transfer giant Western Union Co made an informal takeover approach worth up to A$888 million ($631.10 million).
